arts.ttl: Bompastor hopes Chelsea can make winning 'become easy'
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor wants her side to make winning appear "easy" after beating Celtic to reach the Women's Champions League quarter-finals.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 3-0 Celtic: Blues cruise into Women's Champions League knockout stage - as Sonia Bompastor continues perfect start with 11th straight win
arts.sum: Lucy Bronze opened the scoring in the first minute with a wonderful volley, and further goals from Wieke Kaptein and Eve Perisset ensured the west London team headed home with three points.

arts.ttl: Chelsea reach Champions League quarter-finals after routine win over Celtic
arts.sum: Sonia Bompastorâ€™s side maintained their 100 per cent record in all competitions this season.

arts.ttl: Erin Cuthbert booed by Celtic fans as TNT Sports commentator forced to address awkward reception live on air
arts.sum: The Scotland international was given a frosty reception by travelling Hoops fans after coming off the bench in the Champions League clash with Chelsea at Stamford Bridge

arts.ttl: WCL: Chelsea vs Celtic team news LIVE!
arts.sum: Chelsea boss Sonia Bompastor has stressed the importance of taking every opponent'seriously' following her dream start to life at Stamford Bridge. I make sure we work really hard, as a team, as a club, to succeed and to have a good dynamic.

arts.ttl: Why fearless Aberdeen ARE the real deal as Jonny Hayes rips into notion that Thelin's team will fall away
arts.sum: Aberdeen have won 10 of their first 11 league matches under new boss Jimmy Thelin and former Dons winger Jonny Hayes believes his old side can go the distance

arts.ttl: Sam Kerr injury: Sonia Bompastor provides positive update on Chelsea star
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has provided a positive update on Sam Kerr's recovery from an ACL injury, hinting she could be back in team training by the end of the year.

arts.ttl: Homophobic abuse of Kerr and Mewis 'crazy' - Bompastor
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor says "it's just crazy for me to understand how people can react like this" about homophobic comments aimed at Sam Kerr and Kristie Mewis after their baby announcement.

arts.ttl: Bompastor offers support to Kerr after homophobic online abuse
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has offered her full support to Sam Kerr after the striker was subjected to homophobic abuse online following the announcement she was expecting a baby with her partner, West Ham midfielder Kristie Mewis.

arts.ttl: What Hayes has done at USA is incredible - Wiegman
arts.sum: England women's manager Sarina Wiegman says Emma Hayes has done an "incredible" job as the Lionesses prepare to face Hayes' USA side on 30 November at Wembley.
